page.title: 14The Residential Area.
page.content: The eastern edge of our block is the only densely populated area but very few families have lived in the area for any length of time. The majority of men have work. There are some large families but mostly the families have three or less children. Basic foodstuffs are bought locally otherwise families shop in the larger towns nearby. There are excellent bus services to these towns as well as about half the families having a car. Most of the families stay at home for entertainment, television and videos providing most of this. A few children belong to clubs. Some parents are members of local societies. There is a thriving Community Centre which was built 1972. There is a daily playgroup, ladies groups use it in the afternoons and each evening it is used for all kinds of youth activities.
